author: Special Correspondent
text:
District Election Officer and Collector S. Natarajan inspected functioning of a flying squad formed to check vehicles, carrying of cash and freebies meant to be given for voters in the May 16 Assembly elections.

Couple of days after forming 12 flying squads, three each for the four Assembly constituencies in the district for carrying out round-the-clock vehicle checking, Mr. Natarajan inspected the functioning of a squad on the Ramanathapuram-Rameswaram National Highway in Tiruvadanai Assembly segment on Monday.

The Collector ascertained whether the whole checking process was videographed and the squad members checked the vehicles as per rules. He instructed the squad members to carry out the checking in an impartial manner without giving any prejudicial treatment to any party.

Earlier, the Collector, addressing police personnel, explained the single window system created for giving permission to political parties for organising poll meetings and rallies after they applied permission to organise campaign meetings and rallies through online.

The Collector also addressed owners of printing presses and sensitised them on the procedures to be followed when they take orders for printing pamphlets and wall posters for political parties.

After political parties announced their candidates, the press owners should print pamphlets and posters on their behalf only after obtaining their consent, the Collector said.
title: Flying squad inspected
